sentence.text: Alterations in MEK1/2 occur in cancers, both in the treatment-naÃ¯ve state and following targeted therapies, most notably protein phosphorylation and MEK inhibitors in BRAF-V600E-mutant melanoma and colorectal cancer.

This work highlights the importance of classifying mutations based on structural and phenotypic consequences, both in terms of pathway signaling output and response to pharmacologic inhibition.Implications: This study suggests that alternate modes of target inhibition, such as angiogenesis inhibition, will be required to effectively treat tumors harboring these MEK1/2-resistant alleles.
